snippet: Bill de Blasio, a presumptive mayoral candidate, received about $85,000 in the last six months from yellow taxi industry affiliates, according to documents.
abstract: Fund-raising records for Bill de Blasio, New York public advocate and presumptive candidate for mayor, show that his campaign received about $85,000 in the last six months from executive, lobbyists and other affiliates of the yellow taxi industry; donations coincide with an aggressive attempt by the industry to derail a Bloomberg administration plan that would have allowed hundreds of new metered livery cabs in parts of the city traditionally under-served by yellow taxis.
lead_paragraph: Bill de Blasio, a presumptive mayoral candidate, received about $85,000 in the last six months from yellow taxi industry affiliates, according to documents.

headline.seo: De Blasio Reaps Big Donations From Taxi Industry He Aided
headline.main: Taxi Industry Opens Wallet for de Blasio, a Chief Ally
headline.print_headline: Taxi Industry Opens Wallet For de Blasio, a Chief Ally
